brief.brief: The field to check for modifications.
The fields specified for Auditing can be of any data type, except arrayed structures or fields within arrayed structures.
You can specify any number of fields, however, auditing overhead increases as the number of fields increase.

detail.detail: Do not specify all fields within a table for Auditing. Analyze the fields with the table and select those that are critical in the management of the table's data records.
The recommended maximum number of fields to Audit is 20. Higher numbers cause performance degradation. Under most circumstances, the recommended maximum will not impair the management of a table.

There is a one-to-one correlation between the Field Name and Alias input fields. Due to processing considerations, these are independent arrays. When scrolling one, you must also scroll the other to keep the definitions synchronized.
